data.title: At The Movies: McMovies in the age of McCool
data.meta_description: A Knight's Tale, with Heath Ledger, Shannyn Sossamon and Rufus Sewell, at thePalace 12, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs).Hunky peasant Heath Ledger ("The Patriot")
data.text:
With a name like Jewel Valentine, you know she's got to be trouble. Liv Tyler, who plays Jewel, and Matt Dillon star in "One Night at McCool's" with Paul Reiser, John Goodman, Andrew Dice Clay, Reba McEntire and Michael Douglas.

JAMIE MIDGLEY / Associated Press

Below: Thee cheers for the, like, knight dude. "A Knight's Tale" puts a new modern-rockish spin on an olde story.

EGON ENDERENYI / Associated Press

OPENING THIS WEEK

A Knight's Tale , with Heath Ledger, Shannyn Sossamon and Rufus Sewell, at the Palace 12, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). Hunky peasant Heath Ledger ("The Patriot") dons armor and masquerades as a noble knight at jousting tourneys in a Middle Ages in order to win his fair maiden in this modernized spin on "The Canterbury Tales" that features a naked Chaucer and a soundtrack of modern rock tunes. 132 minutes. Rated PG-13 (profanity, violence, partial nudity, sexuality). 3

The Dish , with Sam Neill, Patrick Warburton and Roy Billing, at the Southroads 20. This comic portrait looks in on a group of Australian scientists running a remote, outback satellite dish that relays images from NASA's Apollo 11 moon landing. 101 minutes. Rated PG-13 (brief strong language). 3

ON IMAX

Cyberworld , at the Tulsa. IMAX's 3-D technology blasts viewers into animation's third dimension with this computer-generated journey through wild adventures and spectacular images. Under the guidance of a saucy, synthetic hostess named Phig (voiced by Jenna Elfman of TV's "Dharma & Greg"), the film teams viewers up with new characters and old friends (from "The Simpsons" and "ANTZ") in a tale in which three unwelcomed intruders named Buzzed, Wired and Frazzled inadvertantly destroy the cyber-environment's foundation, forcing Phig into a hilarious battle to save herself and Cyberworld 3-D from total annihilation. Not rated.

Mission to Mir , at the Tulsa. This giant-screen space shot launches audiences into orbit with NASA astronauts and Russian cosmonauts for an up-close look at life aboard the first long-term space station -- Mir. In this 1997 film, IMAX moviemakers recorded a unique look inside the weightless environment that was occupied by scientists from 1986 until its recent scuttling, capturing the excitement and emotion of pre-mission training, tense space launches and delicate docking maneuvers in intricate, clear, large-screen detail. 40 minutes. Not rated.

Cirque du Soleil: Journey of Man , at the Tulsa. A mystical journey through the stages of man is related in giant-screen 3-D IMAX imagery as the bizarro Canadian acrobats of Cirque du Soleil perform their strange, innovative and wonderful tricks. From Taiko drummers to synchronized swimmers, bungee acrobats and clownish Flounes, the unique artistry of Cirque du Soleil is on display in breathtaking, larger-than-life images. 38 minutes. Rated G.

Across the Sea of Time , with Peter Riznik and John McDonough, at the Tulsa. This IMAX 3-D film takes a trip back in time to examine the history of New York and the United States as seen through the eyes of a young Russian immigrant come to America in search of a long-lost family ancestor. Uses rare antique stereoptic photographs of early-day New York, juxtaposed with 3-D images to create a stunning picture of the Big Apple in vintage times. 51 minutes. Not rated.

FIRST RUN

Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon (in Mandarin with subtitles), with Chow Yun-Fat, Michelle Yeoh and Zhang Ziyi, at the Southroads 20. In this mythic martial-arts epic -- ambitious and sweeping as a Far Eastern "Gone With the Wind" -- director Ang Lee returns to his Chinese roots after creating such celebrated Western films as "The Ice Storm," "Sense and Sensibility," and "Ride With the Devil." Chow Yun-Fat and Michelle Yeoh are Wudan fighters out to capture a murderous bandit called Jade Fox in a dazzling adventure that has them tripping across rooftops and dueling in the tree tops of a bamboo forest. Oscar nominations: best picture, best foreign film, director, adapted screenplay. 120 minutes. Rated PG-13 (martial-arts violence, mild sexuality). 4

Amores Perros (in Spanish with subtitles) with Emilio Echevarria, Gael Garcia Bernal and Goya Toledo, at the Southroads 20. Mexico's Oscar nominee for best foreign film is from director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, and it interweaves three complex storylines that examine a trio of far-flung characters who are catapulted into life-changing dramas by a car wreck and the seemingly inconsquential destiny of a dog named Cofi. 153 minutes. Rated R (sexuality, language, violence, animal cruelty). 3.5

Memento , with Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss and Joe Pantoliano, at the Southroads 20. In classic film noir fashion, writer-director Christopher Nolan's crime saga follows a memory-impaired anti-hero as he tries to piece together the events surrounding the rape and murder of his wife. In classic indie-film fashion, Nolan juices his story with dazzling visual flourishes and relates the narrative in a dizzying, fast-rewind fashion. 120 minutes. Rated R (violence, language, some drug content). 3.5

Bridget Jones's Diary , with Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth, at the Southroads 20, Tulsa, Woodland Hills, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow). Zellweger put on 15 pounds to play writer Helen Fielding's famed "singleton," who finds herself caught between two men, Grant's Daniel Cleaver and Firth's Mark Darcy. Sharon Maguire directs from a screenplay by Fielding and Richard Curtis. 95 minutes. Rated R (language, strong sexuality). 3.5

O Brother, Where Art Thou? , with George Clooney, John Turturro and Tim Blake Nelson, at the Palace 12 and Starworld 20. Those zany Coen Brothers ("Raising Arizona," "Fargo") have gone and made the movie whose title was the punchline for a "socially conscious" film in the classic "Sullivan's Travels." Then they mixed in mythical elements of Homer's "Odyssey" and came up with a Depression-era musical about three escapees from a Mississippi chain gang on a quest to find a hidden cache of loot. Oscar nomination: adapted screenplay. 106 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, depiction of animal death). 3.5

The Mummy Returns , with Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Freddie Boath, at the Southroads 20, Woodland Hills, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso, Admiral Drive-in and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). This sequel marks the early start of summer blockbuster season, again giving us Fraser's Rick O'Connell in an adventure that starts when Imhotep is resurrected in the British Museum. This one's written and directed by Stephen Sommers, who created the original. 121 minutes. Rated PG-13 (violence, horror effects, language). 3

One Night at McCool's , with Liv Tyler, Matt Dillon and Paul Reiser, at the Southroads 20, Woodland Hills, Tulsa, Starworld 20 and Owasso. This steamy story, told from three viewpoints, shows what happens when a dead body turns up at McCool's bar, mysteriously connected to a conniving stunner named Jewel Valentine (Tyler). Joining the ensemble of director Harald Zwart's plot-tangled film are John Goodman, Andrew Dice Clay, Reba McEntire and Michael Douglas. 93 minutes. Rated R (profanity, violence, sexuality). 3

The Forsaken , with Kerr Smith, Brendan Fehr and Isabella Miko, at the Palace 12, Tulsa and Starworld 20. Vampires return in this tale of a young fellow named Sean (Smith), who picks up a hitchhiker named Nick (Fehr). Soon it develops that Nick is hunting a band of youths who feed on victims in the dark of night. Miko plays a girl left for dead by the vampires and Johnathan Schaech is Kit, head of the undead lost boys. 90 minutes. Rated R (horror effects, violence, language, nudity, sexual situations). 3

Blow , with Johnny Depp, Penelope Cruz and Ray Liotta, at the Southroads 20, Tulsa and Starworld 20. Depp stars in this eagerly awaited, fact-based drama about an American drug smuggler working for the Colombian drug cartel in the 1970s. Ted Demme ("The Ref," "Beautiful Girls") is director. 124 minutes. Rated R (pervasive drug content, language, violence, sexuality). 3

The Brothers , with Bill Bellamy, Morris Chestnut, D.L. Hughley and Shemar Moore, at the Southroads 20. Four black friends (Bellamy, Chestnut, Hughley and Moore) bond and bar-hop and share their philosophies regarding the opposite sex, as a wedding looms in the near future for one of them. 102 minutes. Rated R (language, sexual content, partial nudity, mild violence). 3

Enemy at the Gates , with Jude Law, Ed Harris and Joseph Fiennes, at the Palace 12, Starworld 20 and Cinema 8 (Sand Springs). This epic World War II drama, inspired by a true story, stars Law as a Russian sharpshooter targeted for extermination by a Nazi marksman (Harris) during the bloody siege of Stalingrad. Directed by Jean-Jacques Annaud ("Seven Years in Tibet," "The Bear"). 129 minutes. Rated R (graphic violence, profanity, sexuality, brief nudity). 3

Monkeybone , with Brendan Fraser, Bridget Fonda and Whoopi Goldberg, at the Admiral Drive-in. This bizarre combination of live-action and animated fantasy from director Henry Selick ("Nightmare Before Christmas," "James and the Giant Peach") tells about an angst-ridden cartoonist (Fraser) who becomes trapped in his own animated nightmare after he falls into a coma. 87 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, cartoon violence, strong sexual innuendo). 3

Town & Country , with Warren Beatty, Diane Keaton and Andie MacDowell, at the Southroads 20, Woodland Hills, Tulsa, Starworld 20 and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow). Warren Beatty heads an ensemble cast in this tale of a successful architect shocked by his friend's divorce plans and confronted with the suspicions of his wife. Peter Chelsom ("Hear My Song") directs from a screenplay by Buck Henry and Michael Laughlin. 95 minutes. Rated R (language, sexuality, adult themes). 2.5

Kingdom Come , with Whoopi Goldberg, LL Cool J and Vivica A. Fox, at the Southroads 20 and Cinema 8 (Sand Springs). A saga about a family that gathers for a three-day weekend upon the death of the patriarch. The surviving matriarch is Goldberg. Others in the impressive cast include Toni Braxton, Cedric the Entertainer, Ellen Cleghorne, Jada Pinkett Smith, and Clifton Davis. 92 minutes. Rated PG (language, sensuality). 2.5

Along Came a Spider , with Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter and Michael Wincott, at the Southroads 20, Woodland Hills, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). Freeman reprises his role from "Kiss the Girls" as world-weary detective Alex Cross in this second film from the mystery novels of James Patterson. This time, Potter co-stars in a story about the kidnapping of a congressman's daughter. 100 minutes. Rated R (language, violence). 2.5

Spy Kids , with Antonio Banderas, Alan Cumming and Carla Gugino, at the Palace 12, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). A surprise shift to the youth and family market by Dimension Films (of "Scream" fame), this movie details the adventures of children who have a grand time saving their espionage parents from trouble. Banderas leads the cast for director Robert Rodriguez (of "El Mariachi" and "Desperados"), and the studio was reportedly so pleased, they ordered up a sequel even before the original was completed. 90 minutes. Rated PG (violence). 2.5

Someone Like You , with Ashley Judd, Greg Kinnear and Marisa Tomei, at the Tulsa, Starworld 20 and Palace 12. Formerly titled "Animal Husbandry," and based on the popular novel of that name, this romantic comedy stars Judd as a single, urban TV producer. Inspired by a haywire relationship with Kinnear, she begins an exhaustive study of men and turns it into a popular sex-advice column. 94 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, human and bovine sexual situations). 2.5

Heartbreakers , with Sigourney Weaver, Jennifer Love Hewitt and Gene Hackman, at the Starworld 20. Weaver and Hewitt are mother-daughter grifters: Mama marries 'em, sexy daughter seduces 'em, and both swindle them for all they're worth. 123 minutes. Rated PG-13 (sexuality). 2.5

Chocolat , with Juliette Binoche, Johnny Depp and Judi Dench, at the Southroads 20, Woodland Hills and Starworld 20. Lasse Hallstrom ("The Cider House Rules") directs this enchanted tale of a young woman who opens a chocolate shop in a French village and discovers her sweets have an unexpected, liberating effect -- putting her on a collision course with the town's uptight burghers. Oscar nominations: best picture, actress (Binoche), supporting actress (Dench), adapted screenplay. 121 minutes. Rated PG-13 (sensuality, mild violence). 2.5

Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles , with Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski and and Serge Cockburn, at the Palace 12, Tulsa, Starworld 20 and Owasso. Hogan brings back his rustic Australian adventurer in a comedy-drama that starts when his wife Sue's father summons her to America to run the family newspaper. Kozlowski again plays Sue, with young Cockburn as the son brought to visit mom's native land for the first time. In the wilds of L.A., Mick gets involved in a murder investigation. 95 minutes. Rated PG (language, brief violence). 2

Josie and the Pussycats with Rachael Leigh Cook, Tara Reid and Alan Cumming, at the Palace 12, Starworld 20 and Owasso. A live-action version of the popular '70s cartoon show about the all-girl rock band that first surfaced in "Archie" comics. 91 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, mild sensuality). 2

Driven , with Sylvester Stallone, Burt Reynolds and Kip Pardue, at the Southroads 20, Tulsa, Starworld 20, Owasso, Admiral Drive-in and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). Stallone makes a bid to jump-start his sputtering career by writing a new role for himself -- a la "Rocky." He again teams with director Renny Harlin ("Cliffhanger") and plays a former championship auto racing team winner who comes back to aid a young contender who is cracking up. 109 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, violence). 1.5

Joe Dirt , with David Spade, Kid Rock and Gary Busey, at the Southroads 20, Starworld 20, Owasso and Cinema 8 (Broken Arrow, Sand Springs). Spade enters into Adam Sandler territory for this slapstick comedy about an uncouth radio deejay on the hunt for his trashy parents. They abandoned him when he was 8 at the Grand Canyon because he was such a pain in the neck. 86 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, sexuality, crude humor). 1.5

Exit Wounds , with Steven Seagal, Tom Arnold and DMX, at the Southroads 20. The latest action film to test the acting chops of the famously wooden Seagal has the star in combat against a gang of corrupt inner-city cops. 95 minutes. Rated R (strong violence, language, nudity, sexuality). 1.5

3000 Miles to Graceland , Kurt Russell, Kevin Costner and Courteney Cox, at the Admiral Drive-in. It's Elvis Week in Vegas, but five of the revelers are toting heavy firearms in their guitar cases. It's the heist of a lifetime, orchestrated by Russell and his former cellmate Costner. The crooked Elvises steal $3.2 million and high-tail it for Memphis, but that's when their troubles begin. 120 minutes. Rated R (graphic violence, partial nudity, profanity, sexuality). 1

Freddy Got Fingered , with Tom Green, Rip Torn and Marisa Coughlan, at the Southroads 20 and Starworld 20. MTV madman Green is the director, co-writer and star of this tale of a slacker in his late 20s who refuses to move out of his father's house and get a job, as his younger brother Freddy has. 95 minutes. Rated R (profanity, gory sequences, bizarre sexuality). 1/2 star

SECOND RUN

Traffic , with Benicio Del Toro and Michael Douglas, at the Movies 8, Fontana and Super Saver. 147 minutes. Rated R (drug use, profanity, violence, sexuality). 3.5

Cast Away , with Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt, at the Movies 8, Fontana and Super Saver. 143 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, action violence). 3.5

The Mexican , with Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts and James Gandolfini, at the Movies 8, Fontana and Super Saver. 123 minutes. Rated R (profanity, violence, mild sexuality). 3

Hannibal , with Anthony Hopkins and Julianne Moore, at the Movies 8, Fontana and Super Saver. 131 minutes. Rated R (strong graphic violence, horror effects, language). 3

Thirteen Days , with Kevin Costner and Bruce Greenwood, at the Movies 8. 120 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language). 3

What Women Want , with Mel Gibson and Helen Hunt, at the Movies 8 and Super Saver. 123 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, sexual content). 3

The Emperor's New Groove , with the voices of David Spade and Eartha Kitt, at the Movies 8, Fontana and Super Saver. 78 minutes. Rated G. 3

Down to Earth , with Chris Rock, Chazz Palmintieri and Regina King, at the Movies 8 and Super Saver. 85 minutes. Rated PG-13 (mild language). 2

Double Take , with Orlando Jones and Eddie Griffin, at the Fontana. 88 minutes. Rated PG-13 (profanity, violence). 2

The Wedding Planner , with Jennifer Lopez and Matthew McConaughey, at the Movies 8. 102 minutes. Rated PG-13 (language, mild sexuality). 2

See Spot Run , with David Arquette and Leslie Bibb, at the Movies 8 and Super Saver. 95 minutes. Rated PG (comic violence, potty humor). 1
